comment._content: Part of the distinctive building at the right of view remains today at the corner of Market and Sussex Streets Sydney. Here's a Google Street View look at it: maps.google.com.au/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] I wonder why they didn't restore the interesting roof to the Corn Exchange building.

Puzzled by "AS ORIGINALLY BUILT".  Was the approach ramp rebuilt at some time, and made less steep?

@ State Records NSW - "Pyrmont" x 2.  I am not really all that fussed about shpelynge;  it's just that it messes up later searches in flickr

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: beachcomberaustralia - I've been wondering about the "as originally built" notation too - trying to work out the significance. The NSW Heritage listing gives this information: Modifications and Dates: In later years the bridge deck was resurfaced with asphalt. Following the closure of Pyrmont Bridge to vehicular traffic the eastern approach was demolished to make way for the Western Distributor. A pedestrian bridge was constructed over the distributor to link Pyrmont Bridge to Market Street. In 1987 a section of the monorail track was constructed across the Pyrmont Bridge. Further works at the eastern end of the bridge, in 1996, included the introduction of a pair of escalators and a set of stairs to the Cockle Bay promenade. ref. www.heritage.nsw.gov.au/07_subnav_01_2.cfm?itemid=5053337 This view is also useful: www.heritage.nsw.gov.au/07_subnav_01_3.cfm?itemid=4500383... There is a great deal of information about the history of the Western Distributor's construction here: www.ozroads.com.au/NSW/Freeways/WesternDistributor/constr... But it is difficult to discern which stage may have altered the approach/exit to the Pyrmont Bridge, or even if there were significant changes before that.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] Comparing the original Corn Exchange Building with this wonderful rooftop to the modern version with the flat roof...it looks unfinished somehow.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Oops, thanks.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] Thanks for all that information. i don't think the stone balustrade is still there on the Sydney city side of the bridge; only on the Pyrmont side. See street view from the Western Distributor maps.google.com.au/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&... I cannot yet find reference to the approaches being altered. The Pyrmont side was steeper at a 1 in 11 gradient. Something may turn up.

Or is it an optical illusion? - from.ph/28399

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Terrific find - it is reassuring to know that humans were still incompetent in the old days.  I was interested to read that there were plans for a railway around eastern Darling Harbour.  Why was this never built?
